com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app

Class AppPublics.ReloadBroadcastListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.AppPublics.ComponentBroadcastListener
      • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.AppPublics.ReloadBroadcastListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AppPublics.BroadcastListener
    Enclosing class:
    AppPublics

    public abstract static class AppPublics.ReloadBroadcastListener
extends AppPublics.ComponentBroadcastListener
    A broadcast listener which only watch after AppPublics#LOAD_ACTION loading intent actions.

    It is especially useful for indicating to an entity that it should reload its content.

    Since:
    2011.08.02

    • Method Detail

      • broadcastReload

        public static void broadcastReload(android.content.Context context,
                   java.lang.Class<? extends android.app.Activity> targetActivityClass,
                   java.lang.Class<?> targetComponentClass)
        Triggers a reload event through a broadcast intent action.
        Parameters:
        context - the context which will be used to trigger the event
        targetActivityClass - the class which should receive the loading event; it is not allowed to be null
        targetComponentClass - an optional (may be null) class which refines the component that should receive the event

      • addReload

        public static android.content.IntentFilter addReload(android.content.IntentFilter intentFilter,
                                     java.lang.Class<? extends android.app.Activity> targetActivityClass,
                                     java.lang.Class<?> targetComponentClass)
        Creates an IntentFilter which is able to listen for a broadcast reload events.
        Parameters:
        intentFilter - an already existing intent filter, which will be enriched
        targetActivityClass - the class which is supposed to receive the broadcast event
        targetComponentClass - an optional (may be null) class which refines the component that is supposed to receive the event
        Returns:
        the provided intent filter, which has been enriched

      • matchesReload

        public static boolean matchesReload(android.content.Intent intent,
                    java.lang.Class<? extends android.app.Activity> targetActivityClass,
                    java.lang.Class<?> targetComponentClass)
        Indicates whether an intent matches a reload broadcast event.
        Parameters:
        intent - the intent that has been received and which is to be analyzed
        targetActivityClass - the class which is supposed to receive the broadcast event
        targetComponentClass - an optional (may be null) class which refines the component that is supposed to receive the event
        Returns:
        true if and only if the intent matches the expected event

      • getAction

        protected java.lang.String getAction()
        Specified by:
        getAction in class AppPublics.ComponentBroadcastListener

      • getIntentFilter

        public android.content.IntentFilter getIntentFilter()
        Description copied from interface: AppPublics.BroadcastListener
        This method will be invoked by the framework to determine what IntentFilter should be associated to the current listener.

        The returned value of the method will be used to invoke the Context.registerReceiver(android.content.BroadcastReceiver, IntentFilter) method. If this method is annotated with AppPublics.UseNativeBroadcast, the implementation will use the LocalBroadcastManager implementation.

        Returns:
        if not null, only the intents that match with this returned value, will be received by the activity
        See Also:
        AppPublics.BroadcastListener.onReceive(Intent)

      • onReceive

        public void onReceive(android.content.Intent intent)
        Description copied from interface: AppPublics.BroadcastListener
        Is invoked every time an intent that matches is received by the underlying activity.
        Parameters:
        intent - the broadcast Intent which has been received, and which matches the declared IntentFilter
        See Also:
        AppPublics.BroadcastListener.getIntentFilter()

      • onReload

        protected abstract void onReload()
        The callback that will be triggered if the AppPublics.RELOAD_ACTION action is caught for the provided Activity class.
